Package gov.nist.blockmatrixtimestamped

Class BlockTensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nist.blockmatrixtimestamped.BlockTensor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockTensorTimestamped 
    public class BlockTensor
extends java.lang.Object
    Blocktensor data structure, an alternative to blockchain allowing addition and erasure of blocks with log(size) complexity if used with optimal settings. Optimal width is 3 and optimal dimCount is log(size)/log(3). You can choose dimCount and width manually or just provide the size you need and optimal parameters will be chosen automatically.

    • Field Detail

      • HASH_ARRAY_SIZE

        public static final int HASH_ARRAY_SIZE
        Since SHA-256 is used, hash array size must be 32.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • width

        private final int width
        Width of the blocktensor.

      • dimCount

        private final int dimCount
        Dimension count of the blocktensor.

      • blockData

        private final Tensor<Block> blockData
        Tensor to store the blocks. Its size is width^dimCount.

      • hashes

        private final Tensor<byte[][]> hashes
        Tensor to store hashes of the lines. The indexes of the tensor represent the fixed indexes of the line in question, while the index of the array of hashes is the index of the variable index. Therefore, if we have line represented by fixedIndexes and varDimIdx, we can access its hash via hashes.get(fixedIndexes)[varDimIdx].

      • indexesToBlockNumber

        private final Tensor<java.lang.Integer> indexesToBlockNumber
        Converts index in the underlying tensor to block number. Block numbers start at {0,0,...,0} and are propagated via breadth-first search. This tensor is initialized when the blocktensor is created.

      • blockNumberToIndexes

        private final java.util.ArrayList<int[]> blockNumberToIndexes
        Converts block number in the underlying tensor to index. Block numbers start at {0,0,...,0} and are propagated via breadth-first search. This array is initialized when the blocktensor is created.

      • size

        private int size
        Number of blocks added to the blocktensor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockTensor

        public BlockTensor​(int width,
                   int dimCount)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create new blocktensor with given width and dimCount. May not be optimal.
        Parameters:
        width - width, a positive integer
        dimCount - dimension count, an integer greater than 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument does not satisfy the requirements

      • BlockTensor

        public BlockTensor​(int size)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create new blocktensor to accomodate at least the provided size. dimCount is set to log(size)/log(3) and width is set to 3.
        Parameters:
        size - maximum number of elements you will have, a positive integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is not positive

      • getData

        public byte[] getData​(int blockNumber)
               throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Get data of the given block number.
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - block number, an integer in interval [0 .. capacity)
        Returns:
        data of the block, returns zero-length array if the block has not been set yet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the block number is not in the required interval

        public long getTimestamp​(int blockNumber)
                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Get timestamp of the given block number.
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - block number, an integer in interval [0 .. capacity)
        Returns:
        timestamp of the block, returns time when the blocktensor was created if the block has not been set yet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the block number is not in the required interval

        Returns:
        hash of the block
        Throws:

      • set

        public byte[] set​(int blockNumber,
                  byte[] data)
           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Set data to the given block. Return the data that was there before or zero-length byte array if the block has not been set yet. You can do set(size(), data) to add a block to the end.
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - block number, an integer in interval [0 .. capacity)
        data - data byte array
        Returns:
        data that was there before or zero-length byte array if the block has not been set yet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the block is not in the required interval

      • add

        public int add​(byte[] data)
        throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Add data to the blocktensor. Equivalent to set(size(), data).
        Parameters:
        data - data byte array
        Returns:
        block number of the added block
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there is not enough space in blocktensor

      • erase

        public byte[] erase​(int blockNumber)
             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Erase the block at given block number. Equivalent to set(blockNumber, new byte[0]).
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - block number, an integer in interval [0 .. capacity)
        Returns:
        previous data at the given block number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • size

        public int size()
        Number of set blocks. Does not decrease after erase and set.
        Returns:
        number of blocks modified

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Maximal number of blocks the blocktensor can accommodate. This number is fixed.
        Returns:
        capacity of blocktensor

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get width of the blocktensor. This number is fixed.
        Returns:
        width of each line in blocktensor

      • getDimCount

        public int getDimCount()
        Get dimension count of the blocktensor. This number is fixed.
        Returns:
        dimension count

      • isValid

        public java.lang.Boolean isValid()
        Check the validity of the blocktensor by checking whether each block has the same hash value stored as the one calculated for it, and checking whether each line hash stored is the same as the one calculated.
        Returns:
        whether the tensor is valid

      • initIndexing

        private void initIndexing()
        Initialize indexing from the data tensor indexes to block numbers. Block number 0 corresponds to {0,0,...,0} and all subsequent block numbers are assigned in order of breadth-first search from this point, i.e. block number 1 is {0,0,...,1} and block number 2 is {0,0,...,1,0}. The mapping in both directions is calculated and stored to be used later.

      • updateAllHashes

        private void updateAllHashes()
        Update all line hashes in the blocktensor.
